definition[0]: a boat that carries people or goods across a river or a narrow area of water
definition[1]: to carry people or things a short distance from one place to another in a boat or other vehicle
example[0]: The ship was used to ferry supplies to Russia during the war.
definition[2]: a ship that carries people, vehicles, or goods across a narrow part of a sea
example[2]: Faster ferries will improve service timings.
example[3]: Work has already started on a new 14-acre ferry terminal (=place where ferries arrive and leave)
example[4]: The ferry operators undertook not to reduce services.
